text: Wood species, veneers, and finishes as per approved shop drawings and submittals
Hardware (hinges, pulls, glides) matches schedule and samples
Moisture content of wood within acceptable range (6–10%)
All materials stored in climate-controlled, dry environment
Cabinets leveled, shimmed, and secured to framing/substrate
Cabinet joints tight and even; face frames flush
Wall panels and trim align with control lines and are plumb and level
Wood blocking in walls confirmed prior to installation of shelving/mirrors
Coordination with appliance contractor completed and clearances verified prior to millwork start
Gaps between millwork and adjacent surfaces caulked or finished per spec
Exposed fasteners minimized and placed neatly or concealed
Trim and casing cut cleanly, aligned properly at corners and joints
Baseboards installed with tight joints and straight alignments
Window stools, aprons, and sills installed square and flush
Wood doors checked for swing, clearance, and consistent margins
Sanding, staining, or sealing completed with uniform appearance
No tool marks, dents, glue stains, or paint drips visible
All surfaces clean, undamaged, and protected until turnover
QA/QC sign-off and client walk-through complete

id: • NBC Part 9 – Finishing Materials and Trim Requirements
• Project Shop Drawings and Finish Schedule
